1#ifndef UVW_EMITTER_INCLUDE_H
2#define UVW_EMITTER_INCLUDE_H

5#include <type_traits>
6#include <functional>
7#include <algorithm>
8#include <utility>
9#include <cstddef>
10#include <vector>
11#include <memory>
12#include <list>
13#include <uv.h>

16namespace uvw {
17
18
19/**
20 * @brief The ErrorEvent event.
21 *
22 * Custom wrapper around error constants of `libuv`.
23 */
24struct ErrorEvent {
25 template<typename U, typename = std::enable_if_t<std::is_integral_v<U>>>
26 explicit ErrorEvent(U val) noexcept
27 : ec{static_cast<int>(val)}
28 {}
29
30 /**
31 * @brief Returns the `libuv` error code equivalent to the given platform dependent error code.
32 *
33 * It returns:
34 * * POSIX error codes on Unix (the ones stored in errno).
35 * * Win32 error codes on Windows (those returned by GetLastError() or WSAGetLastError()).
36 *
37 * If `sys` is already a `libuv` error code, it is simply returned.
38 *
39 * @param sys A platform dependent error code.
40 * @return The `libuv` error code equivalent to the given platform dependent error code.
41 */
42 static int translate(int sys) noexcept;
43
44 /**
45 * @brief Returns the error message for the given error code.
46 *
47 * Leaks a few bytes of memory when you call it with an unknown error code.
48 *
49 * @return The error message for the given error code.
50 */
51 const char * what() const noexcept;
52
53 /**
54 * @brief Returns the error name for the given error code.
55 *
56 * Leaks a few bytes of memory when you call it with an unknown error code.
57 *
58 * @return The error name for the given error code.
59 */
60 const char * name() const noexcept;
61
62 /**
63 * @brief Gets the underlying error code, that is an error constant of `libuv`.
64 * @return The underlying error code.
65 */
66 int code() const noexcept;
67
68 /**
69 * @brief Checks if the event contains a valid error code.
70 * @return True in case of success, false otherwise.
71 */
72 explicit operator bool() const noexcept;
73
74private:
75 const int ec;
76};
77
78
79/**
80 * @brief Event emitter base class.
81 *
82 * Almost everything in `uvw` is an event emitter.<br/>
83 * This is the base class from which resources and loops inherit.
84 */
85template<typename T>
86class Emitter {
87 struct BaseHandler {
88 virtual ~BaseHandler() noexcept = default;
89 virtual bool empty() const noexcept = 0;
90 virtual void clear() noexcept = 0;
91 };
92
93 template<typename E>
94 struct Handler final: BaseHandler {
95 using Listener = std::function<void(E &, T &)>;
96 using Element = std::pair<bool, Listener>;
97 using ListenerList = std::list<Element>;
98 using Connection = typename ListenerList::iterator;
99
100 bool empty() const noexcept override {
101 auto pred = [](auto &&element){ return element.first; };
102
103 return std::all_of(onceL.cbegin(), onceL.cend(), pred) &&
104 std::all_of(onL.cbegin(), onL.cend(), pred);
105 }
106
107 void clear() noexcept override {
108 if(publishing) {
109 auto func = [](auto &&element){ element.first = true; };
110 std::for_each(onceL.begin(), onceL.end(), func);
111 std::for_each(onL.begin(), onL.end(), func);
112 } else {
113 onceL.clear();
114 onL.clear();
115 }
116 }
117
118 Connection once(Listener f) {
119 return onceL.emplace(onceL.cend(), false, std::move(f));
120 }
121
122 Connection on(Listener f) {
123 return onL.emplace(onL.cend(), false, std::move(f));
124 }
125
126 void erase(Connection conn) noexcept {
127 conn->first = true;
128
129 if(!publishing) {
130 auto pred = [](auto &&element){ return element.first; };
131 onceL.remove_if(pred);
132 onL.remove_if(pred);
133 }
134 }
135
136 void publish(E event, T &ref) {
137 ListenerList currentL;
138 onceL.swap(currentL);
139
140 auto func = [&event, &ref](auto &&element) {
141 return element.first ? void() : element.second(event, ref);
142 };
143
144 publishing = true;
145
146 std::for_each(onL.rbegin(), onL.rend(), func);
147 std::for_each(currentL.rbegin(), currentL.rend(), func);
148
149 publishing = false;
150
151 onL.remove_if([](auto &&element){ return element.first; });
152 }
153
154 private:
155 bool publishing{false};
156 ListenerList onceL{};
157 ListenerList onL{};
158 };
159
160 static std::size_t next_type() noexcept {
161 static std::size_t counter = 0;
162 return counter++;
163 }
164
165 template<typename>
166 static std::size_t event_type() noexcept {
167 static std::size_t value = next_type();
168 return value;
169 }
170
171 template<typename E>
172 Handler<E> & handler() noexcept {
173 std::size_t type = event_type<E>();
174
175 if(!(type < handlers.size())) {
176 handlers.resize(type+1);
177 }
178
179 if(!handlers[type]) {
180 handlers[type] = std::make_unique<Handler<E>>();
181 }
182
183 return static_cast<Handler<E>&>(*handlers[type]);
184 }
185
186protected:
187 template<typename E>
188 void publish(E event) {
189 handler<E>().publish(std::move(event), *static_cast<T*>(this));
190 }
191
192public:
193 template<typename E>
194 using Listener = typename Handler<E>::Listener;
195
196 /**
197 * @brief Connection type for a given event type.
198 *
199 * Given an event type `E`, `Connection<E>` is the type of the connection
200 * object returned by the event emitter whenever a listener for the given
201 * type is registered.
202 */
203 template<typename E>
204 struct Connection: private Handler<E>::Connection {
205 template<typename> friend class Emitter;
206
207 Connection() = default;
208 Connection(const Connection &) = default;
209 Connection(Connection &&) = default;
210
211 Connection(typename Handler<E>::Connection conn)
212 : Handler<E>::Connection{std::move(conn)}
213 {}
214
215 Connection & operator=(const Connection &) = default;
216 Connection & operator=(Connection &&) = default;
217 };
218
219 virtual ~Emitter() noexcept {
220 static_assert(std::is_base_of_v<Emitter<T>, T>);
221 }
222
223 /**
224 * @brief Registers a long-lived listener with the event emitter.
225 *
226 * This method can be used to register a listener that is meant to be
227 * invoked more than once for the given event type.<br/>
228 * The Connection object returned by the method can be freely discarded. It
229 * can be used later to disconnect the listener, if needed.
230 *
231 * Listener is usually defined as a callable object assignable to a
232 * `std::function<void(const E &, T &)`, where `E` is the type of the event
233 * and `T` is the type of the resource.
234 *
235 * @param f A valid listener to be registered.
236 * @return Connection object to be used later to disconnect the listener.
237 */
238 template<typename E>
239 Connection<E> on(Listener<E> f) {
240 return handler<E>().on(std::move(f));
241 }
242
243 /**
244 * @brief Registers a short-lived listener with the event emitter.
245 *
246 * This method can be used to register a listener that is meant to be
247 * invoked only once for the given event type.<br/>
248 * The Connection object returned by the method can be freely discarded. It
249 * can be used later to disconnect the listener, if needed.
250 *
251 * Listener is usually defined as a callable object assignable to a
252 * `std::function<void(const E &, T &)`, where `E` is the type of the event
253 * and `T` is the type of the resource.
254 *
255 * @param f A valid listener to be registered.
256 * @return Connection object to be used later to disconnect the listener.
257 */
258 template<typename E>
259 Connection<E> once(Listener<E> f) {
260 return handler<E>().once(std::move(f));
261 }
262
263 /**
264 * @brief Disconnects a listener from the event emitter.
265 * @param conn A valid Connection object
266 */
267 template<typename E>
268 void erase(Connection<E> conn) noexcept {
269 handler<E>().erase(std::move(conn));
270 }
271
272 /**
273 * @brief Disconnects all the listeners for the given event type.
274 */
275 template<typename E>
276 void clear() noexcept {
277 handler<E>().clear();
278 }
279
280 /**
281 * @brief Disconnects all the listeners.
282 */
283 void clear() noexcept {
284 std::for_each(handlers.begin(), handlers.end(),
285 [](auto &&hdlr){ if(hdlr) { hdlr->clear(); } });
286 }
287
288 /**
289 * @brief Checks if there are listeners registered for the specific event.
290 * @return True if there are no listeners registered for the specific event,
291 * false otherwise.
292 */
293 template<typename E>
294 bool empty() const noexcept {
295 std::size_t type = event_type<E>();
296
297 return (!(type < handlers.size()) ||
298 !handlers[type] ||
299 static_cast<Handler<E>&>(*handlers[type]).empty());
300 }
301
302 /**
303 * @brief Checks if there are listeners registered with the event emitter.
304 * @return True if there are no listeners registered with the event emitter,
305 * false otherwise.
306 */
307 bool empty() const noexcept {
308 return std::all_of(handlers.cbegin(), handlers.cend(),
309 [](auto &&hdlr){ return !hdlr || hdlr->empty(); });
310 }
311
312private:
313 std::vector<std::unique_ptr<BaseHandler>> handlers{};
314};
315
316
317}
318
319
320#ifndef UVW_AS_LIB
321#include "emitter.cpp"
322#endif
323
324#endif // UVW_EMITTER_INCLUDE_H
